alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 1:54PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Churchill, north central Mineral, central Pershing and northern Lyon Counties through 230 PM PDT... At 152 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing landspouts along a line extending from 17 miles east of Lovelock to near Sand Mountain. Movement was west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Lovelock, Lahontan Reservoir, Oreana, Middlegate, Silver Springs, Trinity Junction, Hazen, Imlay, Stillwater, Unionville, Junction U.S 50 And Nv 121 (Dixie Valley Rd), Junction U.S 50 And NV 116 (Stuart Rd), Rye Patch Reservoir, Junction I 80 And U.S 95 (exit 83), Star Peak, Fairview Peak, Dixie Valley, Sand Mountain Campground and Junction U.S 95 And NV 120 (Pasture Rd). LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
